Title: Stability a key legacy of Joko Widodo’s problematic presidency
Description: Outgoing Indonesian President Joko Widodo leaves a mixed legacy, having increased his country's economic and international clout but eroded its democratic institutions.

Title: Indonesia’s president-elect Prabowo steps back from Widodo’s constitutional shenanigans
Description: As the curtains close on his presidency, Joko Widodo’s meddlesome efforts to secure the Widodo political dynasty face mounting challenges from an emboldened Prabowo Subianto.

Title: Taiwan must tighten the lid on China’s misinformation campaigns
Description: As influence operations become more central to China’s reunification ambitions, Taiwan must develop effective strategies to stem the tide of misinformation.

Title: Recharging Southeast Asia’s energy security strategy
Description: Southeast Asia’s energy security hinges on a strategic pivot away from gas import dependence and towards battery storage solutions.

Title: Deterrence alone cannot prevent war in the Asia Pacific
Description: As tensions rise in the Asia Pacific, the United States must balance deterrence with diplomacy to prevent an escalating security dilemma.

Title: Where are the women in Indonesia’s energy transition?
Description: Mechanisms must be established to ensure women’s meaningful participation in the policymaking process to facilitate a successful and just energy transition.

Title: Okinawans must not be overlooked in new US–Japan counter-crime forum
Description: The United States and Japan have created a new joint forum to address crimes committed by US military personnel in Okinawa, but its success will hinge on transparency and the inclusion of Okinawans.

Title: Fiji’s HIV surge stems from a funding shortfall
Description: Contrary to popular narratives, Fiji’s drug crisis is simply the spark that lit a waiting fuse after a decade of HIV funding shortfalls.

Title: China–Philippines trust in troubled waters
Description: Increasing legal manoeuvres and military buildups on both sides suggest that a frail resupply deal is not enough to quell escalating tensions between Beijing and Manila in the South China Sea.

Title: Thailand’s establishment strikes another blow against democracy
Description: The dissolution of Thailand’s most popular party and the dismissal of its prime minister have dashed hopes for democratisation.

Title: North Korean trash barrage extends to fifth day, launching over 1200 balloons
Description: North Korea launched more than 1,200 trash balloons over the course of a five-day blitz through Sunday, with around one-third of the balloons landing in South Korea, according to ROK military estimates. The launches since last Wednesday have renewed concerns about the threat the balloons pose to public safety and property, with at least one ...
